name: @waylay/googleMapsDirections
description:
determines if the duration taken between two points: origin and destination is above, in range, or below the given threshold and range.
States
  • Above: travelTimeSec >= thresholdTimeSec
  • Below: travelTimeSec < thresholdTimeSec

Properties
  • origin (required, evaluated)
  • destination (required, evaluated)
  • modeOfTransport (defaults to driving, evaluated)
  • thresholdTimeSec (required, evaluated)
  • API_Key
Origin & destination may be specified as text strings (e.g. "Chicago, IL" or "Darwin, NT, Australia") or as latitude/longitude coordinates.

ModeOfTransport - when you calculate directions, you may specify the transportation mode to use. By default, directions are calculated as driving directions. The following travel modes are supported:
  • driving (default) indicates standard driving directions using the road network.
  • walking requests walking directions via pedestrian paths & sidewalks.
  • bicycling requests bicycling directions via bicycle paths & preferred streets.
  • transit requests directions via public transit routes.

RawData
  • routes: the entire JSON response [Sample]
  • status: status of the request [Doc]
  • travelDistranceMetres: travel distance in metres
  • travelDistranceKM: travel distance in Kilo-Metres
  • travelTimeSec: duration needed in seconds
  • travelTimeMin: duration needed in minutes
  • travelTimeHour: duration needed in hours

For Google Maps API for Work users, you may enter your API Key in the API_Key field. Limits for free users can be read here

Note: the duration returned is a constant value between two points, if you wish to take into account real-time traffic data, you need to be a Google Maps API for Work customer. Feature is not available on this sensor.
author: Dan Dan
